title: E-Commerce Manager
content:
Established in 1981 with a single store in the Northwest of England, the JD Group is a leading omni-channel retailer of Sports Fashion, Outdoors and Gyms with over 60,000 colleagues and over 3,400 stores across several retail fascias in over 30 markets around the world.
JD Italy counts around 50 stores with over 1,700 employees.
Working with the Trading Lead, this role will drive activities to ensure we achieve Revenue, Profit and EBIT targets for our Digital business. The role will work with Buying & Merchandising & Digital Marketing functions to appropriately plan & deliver the activity.
 
Planning

Working with the Trade Lead & Commercial Finance Teams to Plan market targets & phasing
Responsible for the digital trading calendar for the market
Own & drive the key projects and enhancements for the market website & app channels
Be aware of what competitors are doing, looking for new trends and developments

 
Trading

Create the weekly trading summary and daily progress updates
Review previous week’s performance and propose and agree actions for the week
Review daily sales identifying areas of weakness, proposing and taking action to increase sales and ensuring optimal stock availability at all times
Tracking, reporting and recommending solutions for slow sellers
Suggesting markdown and promotional events in line with brand strategy and tracking performance and reporting on successes and missed opportunities
Propose stories and sign off products selected by the Merchandisers to feature on mailers
Propose features and sign off products selected by Merchandiser to promote on the site
Review stores best sellers to promote the best of the stores lines
Refine and optimise merchandising activity by analysing traffic and sales data to improve overall effectiveness across categories

 
Manage

Build strong relationships with colleagues across Digital Marketing, Retail and Marketing teams
Develop & train the trading exec and their weekly workload
Manage the relationship with Operational teams to ensure local warehouse fulfilment is maximised
Manage the relationship with Customer Care to improve the customer experience

 
Key Competencies

Organising & Executing
Analysing & Interpreting
Working with People
Deciding & Initiating Action
Achieving Personal & Work Goals & Objectives

 
Key Competencies

1 Deciding and Initiating Action
2 Leading and Supervising
2 Adhering to Principles and Values
3 Presenting and Communicating Information
3 Analysing
3 Formulating Strategies and Concepts
1 Planning and Organising
